citeinfo.origin: Mr. Bruce Wright from U.S. Geological Survey with dataset modifications by Mr. Serdar Ertep, US Environmental Protection Agency.
citeinfo.title: urbanap020

descript.abstract: This coverage was identified on the USGS Water Resources NSDI Node site at <http://nsdi.usgs.gov>. This data set includes a selection of urban areas in the United States derived from the urban areas layer of the Digital Chart of the World (DCW).The data was then modified by the US Environmental Protection Agency Personnel for use in the Southern Forest Resource Assessment and exported to a shapefile. The USGS FGDC compliant metadata was then modified to reflect any data set edits completed by the US Environmental Protection Agency Personnel. (see process description starting on page 4).
descript.purpose: The digital data sets of the National Atlas are used to create electronic and hard copy maps that depict various aspects of the nation. The data can be used to conduct geographic analysis on National and large regional scales. The digital data will provide a basis from which future revisions of the atlas can be derived.
descript.supplinf: USGS Revisions on source coverage: 1) 6/29/98 - Corrected ellipsoid name from WGS84 to GRS1980 and changed flattening ratio. 2) 11/13/98 - Added State FIPS attribute; move polygons for Altus, OK and Olustee, OK; and edited STATES field for Kansas City and Washington Metro Area. US Enviromental Protection Agency Shapefile Information: The states included within the dataset include: AL, AR, FL, GA, KY, LA, MS, NC, OK, SC, TN, TX, and VA

place.placekt: AL, AR, FL, GA, KY, LA, MS, NC, OK, SC, TN, TX, VA

idinfo.useconst: None. The USDA Forest Service does not guarantee the accuracy of this data.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.3.0.800
idinfo.datacred: 1) USGS- the original urban area coverage and metadata. 2) US Environmental Protection Agency- modifications to data for use in the Southern Forest Resource Assessment (SFRA).

dataqual.logic:
No additional checks for topological consistency were performed on this data set.
Assessment-standard projection: Projection: Albers Equal Area Units: Meters Spheroid: GRS80 Datum: NAD83 First Standard Parallel: 27 degrees 30 minutes Second Standard Parallel: 37 degrees 30 minutes Central Meridian: -90 degrees 00 minutes Latitude of Origin: 25 degrees 00 minutes False Easting: 0.0 False Northing: 0.0

procstep.procdesc: USGS Process Description: Urban polygons from the Digital Chart of the World (DCW) CD-ROM were extracted and converted to ARC/INFO format. Where the urban boundaries extend beyond the 1:2M shoreline, the 2M shoreline was used by "CLIPPING" the urban polygons. Names of the urban areas were added. In large metropolitan areas many smaller areas were labeled as part of the metropolitan area. The state in which the urban area is located was also added. Several areas were modified to conform to the 1:2,000,000-scale hydrography layer. Some smaller polygons that represent undeveloped areas within the urban area were removed and merged with the larger urban area. Military reservations were also removed.

Data Modifications by US Environmental Protection Agency Personnel: Sept. & Oct.-2000: The coverages were downloaded by US Environmental Agency personnel on 22-Sep-2000 in compressed Arc Info Export format along with their associated metadata. The coverages were then reprojected and clipped to match Assessment standard Albers projection and State Assessment coverage boundary coordinates. This process used the Arc Info PROJECT and CLIP command. The coverage then exported as a shapefile.

horizpa.horizpar: All linear delineations are within National Map Accuracy Standards.

vertacc.vertaccr: All linear delineations are within National Map Accuracy Standards.

enttyp.enttypd: Urban areas are places where large populations exist

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of polygon in shapefile units.
Perimeter of polygon in shapefile units

attrdomv.udom: There is no predefined set of valid urban area names. Name represents the most significant place that is in the polygon.

codesetd.codesetn: Codes for the Identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the Outlying Areas of the United States, and Associated Areas, FIPS 5-2, 1987.
codesetd.codesets: U.S. Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The 2-letter abbreviation for the State in which the county is located.
The Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) code used by the U.S. Bureau of the Census for the State in which the dam is located.

distinfo.distliab:
Data Content and Use Disclaimer
The USDA Forest Service, Southern Forest Resource Assessment or SFRA, provides data to users of digital geographic data. The USDA Forest Service is in no way condoning or endorsing the application of these data for any given purpose. It is the sole responsibility of the user to determine whether or not the data is suitable for the intended purpose. It is also the obligation of the user to apply the data in an appropriate and conscientious manner. The USDA Forest Service provides no warranty, nor accepts any liability occurring from any incomplete, incorrect, or misleading data, or from any incorrect, incomplete, or misleading use of the data. Much of the USDA Forest Service data is based on and maintained with Arc Info and Arc View Software developed by the Environmental Systems Research Institute (ESRI). In addition, much of the information presented uses conventions and terms popularized by Arc Info and Arc View and their user community. USDA Forest Service in no way represents the interests of ESRI nor acts as an agent for them.
